title: mrregister
description:
Register two images together using a symmetric rigid, affine or non-linear transformation model.

By default this application will perform an affine, followed by non-linear registration.

FOD registration (with apodised point spread reorientation) will be performed by default if the number of volumes in the 4th dimension equals the number of coefficients in an antipodally symmetric spherical harmonic series (e.g. 6, 15, 28 etc). The -no_reorientation option can be used to force reorientation off if required.

Non-linear registration computes warps to map from both image1->image2 and image2->image1. Similar to Avants (2008) Med Image Anal. 12(1): 26â€“41, registration is performed by matching both the image1 and image2 in a 'midway space'. Warps can be saved as two deformation fields that map directly between image1->image2 and image2->image1, or if using -nl_warp_full as a single 5D file that stores all 4 warps image1->mid->image2, and image2->mid->image1. The 5D warp format stores x,y,z deformations in the 4th dimension, and uses the 5th dimension to index the 4 warps. The affine transforms estimated (to midway space) are also stored as comments in the image header. The 5D warp file can be used to reinitialise subsequent registrations, in addition to transforming images to midway space (e.g. for intra-subject alignment in a 2-time-point longitudinal analysis).

References:

* If FOD registration is being performed:
Raffelt, D.; Tournier, J.-D.; Fripp, J; Crozier, S.; Connelly, A. & Salvado, O. Symmetric diffeomorphic registration of fibre orientation distributions. NeuroImage, 2011, 56(3), 1171-1180

Raffelt, D.; Tournier, J.-D.; Crozier, S.; Connelly, A. & Salvado, O. Reorientation of fiber orientation distributions using apodized point spread functions. Magnetic Resonance in Medicine, 2012, 67, 844-855

type.title: type
type.description: the registration type. Valid choices are: rigid, affine, nonlinear, rigid_affine, rigid_nonlinear, affine_nonlinear, rigid_affine_nonlinear (Default: affine_nonlinear)

image.title: image
image.description: image1 after registration transformed and regridded to the space of image2. Note that -transformed needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

items.title: transformed
items.description: image1 after registration transformed and regridded to the space of image2. Note that -transformed needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

transformed.title: transformed
transformed.description: image1 after registration transformed and regridded to the space of image2. Note that -transformed needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

image1_transformed.title: image1_transformed
image1_transformed.description: image1 and image2 after registration transformed and regridded to the midway space. Note that -transformed_midway needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

image2_transformed.title: image2_transformed
image2_transformed.description: image1 and image2 after registration transformed and regridded to the midway space. Note that -transformed_midway needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

items.title: transformed_midway
items.description: image1 and image2 after registration transformed and regridded to the midway space. Note that -transformed_midway needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

transformed_midway.title: transformed_midway
transformed_midway.description: image1 and image2 after registration transformed and regridded to the midway space. Note that -transformed_midway needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

mask1.title: mask1
mask1.description: a mask to define the region of image1 to use for optimisation.

mask2.title: mask2
mask2.description: a mask to define the region of image2 to use for optimisation.

nan.title: nan
nan.description: use NaN as out of bounds value. (Default: 0.0)

rigid.title: rigid
rigid.description: the output text file containing the rigid transformation as a 4x4 matrix

rigid_1tomidway.title: rigid_1tomidway
rigid_1tomidway.description: the output text file containing the rigid transformation that aligns image1 to image2 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

rigid_2tomidway.title: rigid_2tomidway
rigid_2tomidway.description: the output text file containing the rigid transformation that aligns image2 to image1 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

rigid_init_translation.title: rigid_init_translation
rigid_init_translation.description:
initialise the translation and centre of rotation 
Valid choices are: 
mass (aligns the centers of mass of both images, default), 
geometric (aligns geometric image centres) and none.

rigid_init_rotation.title: rigid_init_rotation
rigid_init_rotation.description:
initialise the rotation Valid choices are: 
search (search for the best rotation using mean squared residuals), 
moments (rotation based on directions of intensity variance with respect to centre of mass), 
none (default).

rigid_init_matrix.title: rigid_init_matrix
rigid_init_matrix.description: initialise either the rigid, affine, or syn registration with the supplied rigid transformation (as a 4x4 matrix in scanner coordinates). Note that this overrides rigid_init_translation and rigid_init_rotation initialisation

rigid_scale.title: rigid_scale
rigid_scale.description: use a multi-resolution scheme by defining a scale factor for each level using comma separated values (Default: 0.25,0.5,1.0)

rigid_niter.title: rigid_niter
rigid_niter.description: the maximum number of gradient descent iterations per stage. This can be specified either as a single number for all multi-resolution levels, or a single value for each level. (Default: 1000)

rigid_metric.title: rigid_metric
rigid_metric.description: valid choices are: diff (intensity differences), Default: diff

rigid_metric_diff_estimator.title: rigid_metric_diff_estimator
rigid_metric_diff_estimator.description: Valid choices are: l1 (least absolute: |x|), l2 (ordinary least squares), lp (least powers: |x|^1.2), Default: l2

rigid_lmax.title: rigid_lmax
rigid_lmax.description: explicitly set the lmax to be used per scale factor in rigid FOD registration. By default FOD registration will use lmax 0,2,4 with default scale factors 0.25,0.5,1.0 respectively. Note that no reorientation will be performed with lmax = 0.

rigid_log.title: rigid_log
rigid_log.description: write gradient descent parameter evolution to log file

affine.title: affine
affine.description: the output text file containing the affine transformation as a 4x4 matrix

affine_1tomidway.title: affine_1tomidway
affine_1tomidway.description: the output text file containing the affine transformation that aligns image1 to image2 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

affine_2tomidway.title: affine_2tomidway
affine_2tomidway.description: the output text file containing the affine transformation that aligns image2 to image1 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

affine_init_translation.title: affine_init_translation
affine_init_translation.description:
initialise the translation and centre of rotation 
Valid choices are: 
mass (aligns the centers of mass of both images), 
geometric (aligns geometric image centres) and none. (Default: mass)

affine_init_rotation.title: affine_init_rotation
affine_init_rotation.description:
initialise the rotation Valid choices are: 
search (search for the best rotation using mean squared residuals), 
moments (rotation based on directions of intensity variance with respect to centre of mass), 
none (Default: none).

affine_init_matrix.title: affine_init_matrix
affine_init_matrix.description: initialise either the affine, or syn registration with the supplied affine transformation (as a 4x4 matrix in scanner coordinates). Note that this overrides affine_init_translation and affine_init_rotation initialisation

affine_scale.title: affine_scale
affine_scale.description: use a multi-resolution scheme by defining a scale factor for each level using comma separated values (Default: 0.25,0.5,1.0)

affine_niter.title: affine_niter
affine_niter.description: the maximum number of gradient descent iterations per stage. This can be specified either as a single number for all multi-resolution levels, or a single value for each level. (Default: 1000)

affine_metric.title: affine_metric
affine_metric.description: valid choices are: diff (intensity differences), Default: diff

affine_metric_diff_estimator.title: affine_metric_diff_estimator
affine_metric_diff_estimator.description: Valid choices are: l1 (least absolute: |x|), l2 (ordinary least squares), lp (least powers: |x|^1.2), Default: l2

affine_lmax.title: affine_lmax
affine_lmax.description: explicitly set the lmax to be used per scale factor in affine FOD registration. By default FOD registration will use lmax 0,2,4 with default scale factors 0.25,0.5,1.0 respectively. Note that no reorientation will be performed with lmax = 0.

affine_log.title: affine_log
affine_log.description: write gradient descent parameter evolution to log file

init_translation_unmasked1.title: init_translation_unmasked1
init_translation_unmasked1.description: disregard mask1 for the translation initialisation (affects 'mass')

init_translation_unmasked2.title: init_translation_unmasked2
init_translation_unmasked2.description: disregard mask2 for the translation initialisation (affects 'mass')

init_rotation_unmasked1.title: init_rotation_unmasked1
init_rotation_unmasked1.description: disregard mask1 for the rotation initialisation (affects 'search' and 'moments')

init_rotation_unmasked2.title: init_rotation_unmasked2
init_rotation_unmasked2.description: disregard mask2 for the rotation initialisation (affects 'search' and 'moments')

init_rotation_search_angles.title: init_rotation_search_angles
init_rotation_search_angles.description: rotation angles for the local search in degrees between 0 and 180. (Default: 2,5,10,15,20)

init_rotation_search_scale.title: init_rotation_search_scale
init_rotation_search_scale.description: relative size of the images used for the rotation search. (Default: 0.15)

init_rotation_search_directions.title: init_rotation_search_directions
init_rotation_search_directions.description: number of rotation axis for local search. (Default: 250)

linstage_iterations.title: linstage_iterations
linstage_iterations.description: number of iterations for each registration stage, not to be confused with -rigid_niter or -affine_niter. This can be used to generate intermediate diagnostics images (-linstage.diagnostics.prefix) or to change the cost function optimiser during registration (without the need to repeatedly resize the images). (Default: 1 == no repetition)

linstage_optimiser_first.title: linstage_optimiser_first
linstage_optimiser_first.description: Cost function optimisation algorithm to use at first iteration of all stages. Valid choices: bbgd (Barzilai-Borwein gradient descent) or gd (simple gradient descent). (Default: bbgd)

linstage_optimiser_last.title: linstage_optimiser_last
linstage_optimiser_last.description: Cost function optimisation algorithm to use at last iteration of all stages (if there are more than one). Valid choices: bbgd (Barzilai-Borwein gradient descent) or gd (simple gradient descent). (Default: bbgd)

linstage_optimiser_default.title: linstage_optimiser_default
linstage_optimiser_default.description: Cost function optimisation algorithm to use at any stage iteration other than first or last iteration. Valid choices: bbgd (Barzilai-Borwein gradient descent) or gd (simple gradient descent). (Default: bbgd)

linstage_diagnostics_prefix.title: linstage_diagnostics_prefix
linstage_diagnostics_prefix.description: generate diagnostics images after every registration stage

warp1.title: warp1
warp1.description: the non-linear warp output defined as two deformation fields, where warp1 can be used to transform image1->image2 and warp2 to transform image2->image1. The deformation fields also encapsulate any linear transformation estimated prior to non-linear registration.

warp2.title: warp2
warp2.description: the non-linear warp output defined as two deformation fields, where warp1 can be used to transform image1->image2 and warp2 to transform image2->image1. The deformation fields also encapsulate any linear transformation estimated prior to non-linear registration.

anyOf.title: nl_warp
anyOf.description: the non-linear warp output defined as two deformation fields, where warp1 can be used to transform image1->image2 and warp2 to transform image2->image1. The deformation fields also encapsulate any linear transformation estimated prior to non-linear registration.

nl_warp.title: nl_warp
nl_warp.description: the non-linear warp output defined as two deformation fields, where warp1 can be used to transform image1->image2 and warp2 to transform image2->image1. The deformation fields also encapsulate any linear transformation estimated prior to non-linear registration.

nl_warp_full.title: nl_warp_full
nl_warp_full.description: output all warps used during registration. This saves four different warps that map each image to a midway space and their inverses in a single 5D image file. The 4th image dimension indexes the x,y,z component of the deformation vector and the 5th dimension indexes the field in this order: image1->midway, midway->image1, image2->midway, midway->image2. Where image1->midway defines the field that maps image1 onto the midway space using the reverse convention When linear registration is performed first, the estimated linear transform will be included in the comments of the image header, and therefore the entire linear and non-linear transform can be applied (in either direction) using this output warp file with mrtransform

nl_init.title: nl_init
nl_init.description: initialise the non-linear registration with the supplied warp image. The supplied warp must be in the same format as output using the -nl_warp_full option (i.e. have 4 deformation fields with the linear transforms in the image header)

nl_scale.title: nl_scale
nl_scale.description: use a multi-resolution scheme by defining a scale factor for each level using comma separated values (Default: 0.25,0.5,1.0)

nl_niter.title: nl_niter
nl_niter.description: the maximum number of iterations. This can be specified either as a single number for all multi-resolution levels, or a single value for each level. (Default: 50)

nl_update_smooth.title: nl_update_smooth
nl_update_smooth.description: regularise the gradient update field with Gaussian smoothing (standard deviation in voxel units, Default 2.0)

nl_disp_smooth.title: nl_disp_smooth
nl_disp_smooth.description: regularise the displacement field with Gaussian smoothing (standard deviation in voxel units, Default 1.0)

nl_grad_step.title: nl_grad_step
nl_grad_step.description: the gradient step size for non-linear registration (Default: 0.5)

nl_lmax.title: nl_lmax
nl_lmax.description: explicitly set the lmax to be used per scale factor in non-linear FOD registration. By default FOD registration will use lmax 0,2,4 with default scale factors 0.25,0.5,1.0 respectively. Note that no reorientation will be performed with lmax = 0.

diagnostics_image.title: diagnostics_image
diagnostics_image.description: write intermediate images for diagnostics purposes

directions.title: directions
directions.description: the directions used for FOD reorientation using apodised point spread functions (Default: 60 directions)

noreorientation.title: noreorientation
noreorientation.description: turn off FOD reorientation. Reorientation is on by default if the number of volumes in the 4th dimension corresponds to the number of coefficients in an antipodally symmetric spherical harmonic series (i.e. 6, 15, 28, 45, 66 etc)

mc_weights.title: mc_weights
mc_weights.description: relative weight of images used for multi-contrast registration. Default: 1.0 (equal weighting)

datatype.title: datatype
datatype.description: specify output image data type. Valid choices are: float32, float32le, float32be, float64, float64le, float64be, int64, uint64, int64le, uint64le, int64be, uint64be, int32, uint32, int32le, uint32le, int32be, uint32be, int16, uint16, int16le, uint16le, int16be, uint16be, cfloat32, cfloat32le, cfloat32be, cfloat64, cfloat64le, cfloat64be, int8, uint8, bit.

quiet.title: quiet
quiet.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

force.title: force
force.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

nthreads.title: nthreads
nthreads.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

key.title: key
key.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

value.title: value
value.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

items.title: config
items.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

config.title: config
config.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

help.title: help
help.description: display this information page and exit.

contrast1_contrast2.title: contrast1_contrast2
contrast1_contrast2.description: optional list of additional input images used as additional contrasts. Can be used multiple times. contrastX and imageX must share the same coordinate system.
